entry.title: U.S. Consumer Confidence Rises: Michigan Sentiment Index Beats Expectations in December
entry.content:
Top News
U.S. Consumer Confidence Rises: Michigan Sentiment Index Beats Expectations in December 19 hours ago
The U.S. Michigan Consumer Sentiment Index improved to 53.3 in December, surpassing the previous reading of 51.0 and analyst estimates of 52.0. This increase indicates strengthening confidence among American consumers, which could potentially lead to increased consumer spending and have positive implications for retail sales and economic growth.

entry.title: Landmark Cars Expands BYD Partnership with New Pune Showroom
entry.content:
Landmark Cars Expands BYD Partnership with New Pune Showroom 30 minutes ago
Landmark Cars, India's leading premium automotive retail network, is expanding its partnership with BYD India Private Limited by opening a new showroom and workshop in Pune, Maharashtra. This move marks Landmark Cars' entry into Pune's premium EV market and strengthens its position as BYD's largest retail partner in India. The expansion comes as BYD experiences an 80% surge in sales this year, establishing itself as a leading player in India's premium EV segment. The new facilities will be established through Watermark Cars Private Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Landmark Cars.

entry.title: Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus
entry.content:
Nifty and Sensex Close Higher: IndiGo, Reliance Industries in Focus 1 day ago
Indian markets ended positive with Nifty 50 at 26,180.90 (+0.57%) and Sensex at 85,698.74 (+0.51%). Market breadth was negative with 2,636 declining stocks out of 4,512 traded. IndiGo announced customer service initiatives, Reliance Industries saw significant block trades and a credit rating upgrade, while Lupin received FDA approval for a generic drug. Apollo Micro Systems projected strong revenue growth, and Chambal Fertilisers reported increased promoter shareholding.

entry.title: Mukka Proteins' Joint Venture Secures ₹474.89 Crore Contract for Innovative Leachate Treatment in Bengaluru
entry.content:
Mukka Proteins' Joint Venture Secures ₹474.89 Crore Contract for Innovative Leachate Treatment in Bengaluru 55 minutes ago
Mukka Proteins Limited, known for fish product manufacturing, has entered the environmental solutions sector through a joint venture. The company secured a ₹474.89 crore contract from Bengaluru Solid Waste Management Limited for treating legacy leachate at Mittaganahalli and Kannur landfill sites. The four-year project, with Mukka holding a 76% stake in the JV, involves an estimated CAPEX of ₹100 crore and a six-month construction timeline. This strategic diversification aims to address environmental challenges, ensure zero untreated discharge, and potentially open new opportunities in environmental conservation efforts.
